intro: [WRONG START] Alyssum condensatum var. flexible, commonly known as flexible alyssum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features dense clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has thin, wiry stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental horticulture.
